Malaya YousafZai: I don’t mind if I have to sit on the floor at school. All I want is education. And I’m afraid of no one.
Nelson Mandela: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
Mahatma Gandhi: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
Bill Gates: Success is a lousy teacher. I seduces smart people into thinking they can’t lose.
Fredrich Wilhelm Nietzche: He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to stand and walk and run and climb and dance one cannot fly into flying.
John Dewey: Education is not preparation for life; education is life itself.
Albert Einstein: Education is not preparation for life; education is life itself.
Aristotle: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
B.B. King: The beautiful thing about learning is nobody can take it away from you.
Tom Bodett: Difference between school and life? In school you are taught a lesson and then given a test. In life, you are given a test that teaches you a lesson.
Abraham Lincoln: The things I want to know are in books; my best friend is the man who’ll get me a book I ain’t read.
If you can’t fly then run, if you can’t run then walk, if you can’t walk then crawl, but whatever you do you have to keep moving forward.
Thomas Alva Edisons: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
Walt Disney: We keep moving forward, opening new doors, and doing new things, because we’re curious and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.
William Butlet Yeats: Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire.
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe: What is not started today is never finished tomorrow.
